./.title: Royce Theme
./.body:
Royce Theme
The Royce theme gives fashion-focused Shopify stores a chic and contemporary look. Our guide has been thoughtfully designed to provide you with the best instructions for effortlessly establishing your business. Using our years of Shopify experience, we developed Royce to fully utilize the platform while taking into account the particular requirements of the fashion retail industry.
The purpose of these instructions is to help you along the way. Fashion e-commerce frequently calls for careful modification and setup clarity, even though we intend our themes to be simple and easy to use. With over 10 years of expertise in the fashion and e-commerce industries, our documentation is purposefully opinionated in some areas to ensure you get insights that go beyond the fundamentals.
Important Features:

Portfolio Layout: Showcase your work using masonry or grid layouts that accentuate your artistic abilities.
Customizable Gallery: Provides thorough views of each item, allows you to submit photos with ease, and groups them into collections.
Responsive Design: optimized for desktop and mobile viewing, guaranteeing that your artwork appears fantastic across all platforms.
Product Showcase: Sell prints, artwork, and other creative things straight from your business by combining your portfolio with a product showcase.
Clean And Minimalist Style: Make sure your design is clean and uncomplicated so it doesn't distract from your work.
Header Options: Select the header layout that best fits your branding requirements.
Color Scheme Customization: The theme's colors can be altered to reflect your business or creative aesthetic.
Integrated Social Media Links: In order to interact with your audience, include social media icons that connect to your Instagram, Pinterest, and other sites

Jump right in

getting-started/quickstart.html.title: Shopify
getting-started/quickstart.html.body:
Shopify


Shopify is web based ecommerce software. This means there’s no installation required, and it works with all operating systems (including Windows and MacOS)! Shopify hosts the site itself, so you don’t have to worry about installing, upgrading or maintaining any software or web servers.
Visit https://www.shopify.com/(opens in a new tab) to install Shopify and https://www.shopify.com/in/partners

getting-started/theme-features.html.title: Theme Features
getting-started/theme-features.html.body:
Theme Features
Shopify OS 3.0 Framework

Built on Shopify Online Store 3.0 for faster performance and better flexibility
Modular sections and blocks are available across all pages

Layout & Customization

Multiple page layouts to create varied store structures
Flexible sections with block combinations for fully customized layouts
Multiple header styles to suit different branding needs
Drag-and-drop blocks to easily rearrange homepage content
Custom content blocks to showcase images and unique content
Highly customizable theme settings for colors, fonts, and backgrounds — no coding required

Responsive & User Experience

Fully responsive design optimized for desktop, tablet, and mobile devices
Smooth browsing experience across all screen sizes

Advanced Store Features

AJAX product filters for colors and other attributes
AJAX cart for adding products without leaving the page
AJAX wishlist to save favorite items
Built-in deal timer for promotions and limited-time offers
Product sorting options on collection pages (price, alphabetical, newest, etc.)

Global & Marketing Ready

Built-in multi-currency support (AUD, CAD, USD, GBP, JPY, EUR, NZD, INR)
Newsletter subscription forms (pop-up and standard)
Social sharing support for X (Twitter), Facebook, Instagram, and Pinterest

SEO Optimized

Uses Shopify’s latest SEO standards
Structured product data optimized for Google rich snippets and search visibility

getting-started/support-policy.html.title: Support Policy
getting-started/support-policy.html.body:
Support Policy
We are committed to providing exceptional support and look forward to assisting you to the best of our abilities. This support policy details the level of assistance you can expect from us. By using our Shopify themes, you agree to this support policy. We reserve the right to amend our support policy at any time without prior notice. Support Policies: A supported item includes item support for 6 months from the purchase date. During those 6 months, we are expected to be available to provide the item support services. You’ll also have the option to purchase extended item support, increasing the item support period up to a maximum of 12 months from the date of purchase. We do not provide support for Envato Element subscription users. If you need support from us, then you need to buy the theme from Themeforest. You can refer to our theme documentation to fix your query. Contact Us. We welcome your questions or feedback regarding this Support Policy and our themes. If you have any concerns or believe that we have not adhered to this policy, please contact us. The best ways to contact our Support team are: Email us at support@buddhathemes.com.Leave a comment in the Themeforest item comment section, or contact us via ThemeForest. We do not currently offer phone support or support through social apps like Google Meet, Zoom, or WhatsApp. 
Support Language: Our support services are provided exclusively in English. If you submit a request in a different language, we will try to translate it using an online translation service; however, our responses will be in English. To ensure clarity and avoid any misunderstandings, we strongly recommend that you write your support request in clear and proper English.
Support Eligibility 
We provide support for all our active Shopify themes and app subscriptions purchased through the Shopify Theme Store, Shopify App Store, or ThemeForest. If a theme or application is removed from any of these marketplaces, support for that item will no longer be available, unless stated otherwise. Please note that a valid, registered theme license may be required to receive technical support for themes. For information on locating your purchase code, please refer to the following guide: Where Is My Purchase Code?​
Support Hours 
We strive to monitor support tickets around the clock, but this is not always possible due to different time zones. Our support hours are 9 am - 7 pm (IST), Monday through Friday. Requests are generally processed in the order they are received, except in cases of emergencies or severe technical issues.
Response Times 

Our response times may vary based on our support workload.
For uncommon or complex issues, resolutions might take an additional 1–2 days.
Our Customer Success agent will keep you informed about the progress and estimated timeline.

Custom Work Policy 

If additional work is required, it will be considered custom work.
Custom work is charged at $30 (USD) per hour, depending on your specific requirements.
We will confirm feasibility before proceeding.

Efficient Issue Resolution 

To help us resolve your issue efficiently, please include as many details as possible in your support request.

What Our Support Includes 
We provide support exclusively for our products. Our support scope includes:

Addressing questions about item functionality and general technical capabilities.
Assisting with setting up item features and configuring settings.
Fixing bugs in FoxEcom themes and apps.
Resolving Shopify compatibility issues that arise from a standard theme installation.
Handling some theme conflict issues.
Performing minor and simple customisations, depending on our current request volume.

While we may assist with customisations, please be aware that custom code created for your store might not be fully tested, and we cannot guarantee it will be error-free. Additionally, we do not support transferring custom work to newer versions of the theme.
What Our Support Doesn't Include 
Our products are provided as-is, and we do not offer support for alterations or feature additions. We cannot guarantee ADA compatibility or compatibility with third-party software or services outside of Shopify. Our support does not cover:

Shopify administration or native functionality (for assistance, contact Shopify Support)
Core theme modifications or design changes
Errors caused by customisations, third-party plugins, apps, or template file changes (we recommend reverting to the default theme for resolution)
Compatibility with third-party apps that don't integrate with the item
Setup or troubleshoot for Google, Facebook, or other analytics/tracking apps
SEO setup or issues
App recommendations
Theme installations
Adding new features to older theme versions

how-to-instal-theme/editor.html.title: Theme Installation
how-to-instal-theme/editor.html.body:
Theme Installation
Before installing the theme, please unzip "Classique-shopify-theme.zip" and upload the "Classique.zip" file to Shopify to avoid the "layout/theme.liquid" missing template error.
Theme Extractions 

Download the package from Themeforest.net (it will be in ZIP format).
Find the file "themeforest-xxxxxx-royce-shopify-theme.zip" in your folder.
Extract the contents of the ZIP package you just downloaded.
Upload the royce.zip file to your Shopify store.



Upload Theme Through Shopify Admin Panel



Log in to the Shopify Panel.
Click "Online Store" from the left-hand menu.
Click "Add theme" > "Upload zip file."
Select and upload the royce.zip file. The theme will then be uploaded to your store.
Once the upload is complete, click "Actions" > "Publish."

How to install a Shopify theme

how-to-instal-theme/how-to-navigate-to-b.title: How to navigate to blocks in 3.0?
how-to-instal-theme/how-to-navigate-to-b.body:
How to navigate to blocks in 3.0?
Shopify 3.0 makes it easy to locate and edit specific sections or blocks directly from the storefront preview using the Inspector feature.
Steps to Navigate to a Block

Log in to your Shopify Admin.
Go to Online Store → Themes.
Click Edit theme on your active theme to open the Theme Editor.
Ensure the Inspector mode is enabled (it is enabled by default).
In the live preview, hover over any element such as text, a button, a heading, or an image.
Click the highlighted element.
Shopify will automatically focus and open the corresponding section or block in the settings panel on the left.

Editing the Block

Update content such as text, images, or links.
Adjust styling options available for that specific block.
Changes are reflected instantly in the preview.

This workflow helps you quickly identify and modify the exact element you want without manually searching through sections or blocks.
Your browser does not support video.

theme-settings/logo.html.title: Logo
theme-settings/logo.html.body:
Logo
Use the favicon and logo options to customize the branding of your website. All pages and browser tabs will consistently display the brand thanks to these components.

Go to Online Store> Click Theme Settings icon.
Locate Logo> Upload Images.
Click Save.






Logo
Upload logo image.




Width
Adjust the logo width to fit your header layout.


Favicon
Upload your favicon – a small icon displayed in browser tabs and bookmarks. Size Info Will be scaled down to 32 × 32px, so use a clear, square image for best results.

theme-settings/colors.html.title: Colors
theme-settings/colors.html.body:
Colors
You can alter the look of your store by establishing color schemes that specify the visual style of different parts of your website. This makes it simple to change themes across various sections of your website and preserve consistent branding.

Go to Online Store> Click Theme Settings icon
Locate Color on the left-side
Make necessary changes.
Click Save.



 

Color scheme : You can customize the theme appearance by changing the text color, background color, and more using preset color options.

theme-settings/typography.html.title: Typography
theme-settings/typography.html.body:
Typography
With the Typography settings, you have the freedom to personalize the font styles, sizes, and letter casing for your entire store.

Go to Shopify Admin > Online Store > Themes.
Click Customize on your active theme.
In the Theme Editor, click Theme Settings > Typography .

 

Headings

Configure the font type for all headings used in the theme.
Choose from available font styles to match your brand identity.
You can also use the custom font.
To change the default font size for headings, use the Font size scale to select the default font size. The minimum font size is 100%, and the maximum font size is 125%.

Body

The theme primarily uses the body font as the main font type.
Customize the font type to ensure readability and consistency across your store.
You can also use the custom font.
To change the default font size for the body, use the Font size scale to select the default font size. The minimum font size is 100%, and the maximum font size is 125%.

theme-settings/general-settings.html.title: General Settings
theme-settings/general-settings.html.body:
General Settings
The Theme Settings section in Shopify allows you to fully customize the design and functionality of your store.

Go to Shopify Admin > Online Store > Themes.
Click Customize on your active theme.
In the Theme Editor, click Theme Settings > General settings.



Layout : Adjust overall page structure.



Page width
Set the maximum width of the content container.




Scroll to top
Enable a floating button that lets users quickly scroll to the top of the page.


Animation effect
Choose the animation style for theme content appearance: Fade, Fade Up, Fade Down, or None.

theme-settings/currency-format.html.title: Currency Format
theme-settings/currency-format.html.body:
Currency Format
Currency format refers to the three-letter codes used to represent different currencies (e.g., USD for US Dollar, EUR for Euro, GBP for British Pound). These codes help display product prices in different currencies for international customers.

Go to Shopify Admin > Online Store > Themes.
Click Customize on your active theme.
In the Theme Editor, click Theme Settings > Currency Codes.



Currency Codes

Cart and Checkout Prices : Prices displayed in the cart and during checkout will always include currency codes. (Example: $1.00 USD )
Show Currency Codes : Enable this option to display the currency code alongside product prices throughout the store.

theme-settings/button.html.title: Button
theme-settings/button.html.body:
Button
Buttons are essential elements in your Shopify store, guiding users to add products to the cart, checkout, or explore more pages. Shopify allows you to customize buttons to match your branding and improve user engagement.

Go to Shopify Admin > Online Store > Themes.
Click Customize on your active theme.
In the Theme Editor, click Theme Settings > Buttons.

 




Primary button & Secondary button
​




Font
Select the option from the typography. According to the selected option you will be adjusted to the font family and font size.


Textcase
Use the Text case setting to adjust the text style. ( Uppercase, Default )


Thickness
Adjust the thickness of the button.


Opacity
Adjust the opacity range of the button.


Corner radius
Adjust the corner radius of the button.


Horizontal offset
Adjusts the shadow position on the X-axis.


Vertical offset
Adjusts the shadow position on the Y-axis.


Link button
​


Font
Select the option from the typography. According to the selected option you will be adjusted to the font family and font size.


Testcase
Use the Text case setting to adjust the text style. ( Uppercase, Default )

theme-settings/badge.html.title: Badge
theme-settings/badge.html.body:
Badge
In the badges section, you can customize the Badge position and Corner radius, and also you can change the Background Colour theme and Text color for the Sale, Sold, and a New badge.





Text case
Use the Text case setting to adjust the text style. ( Uppercase, Default )




Corner radius
Adjust the corner radius for the badge field.


Sale, New, Soldout badge
Show badge: Enable badge option.Background: Pick the color for the badge background.Color: Pick the color for the badge text.

theme-settings/input-field.html.title: Input Field
theme-settings/input-field.html.body:
Input Field
In Shopify, Input Settings refer to customizing forms and input fields such as contact forms, search bars, login forms, and checkout fields.

Go to Online Store> Click Theme Settings icon.
Locate Input Fields on the left-side.
Click Save.






Thickness
Adjust the thickness of the input field border.




Corner radius
Adjust the corner radius of the input field.

theme-settings/cards.html.title: Cards
theme-settings/cards.html.body:
Cards
Cards in Shopify are used to display products, collections, blog posts, or promotions in a structured layout. They typically include an image, title, price, description, and buttons (e.g., "Add to Cart" or "View More").

Go to Shopify Admin > Online Store > Themes.
Click Customize on your active theme.
In the Theme Editor, click Theme Settings > Cards.






Wishlist
Enable wishlist to display on the product card.




Compare
Enable compare to display on the product card.


Show quick add option
Enable quick view to display on the product card.

theme-settings/cart.html.title: Cart
theme-settings/cart.html.body:
Cart
The Cart in Shopify is where customers review their selected products before proceeding to checkout. You can customize the cart page, drawer cart (side cart), cart icon, and cart behavior to improve the shopping experience.

Go to Shopify Admin > Online Store > Themes.
Click Customize on your active theme.
In the Theme Editor, click Theme Settings > Social Icons.






Cart type
Choose the cart type Drawer / Page.Drawer: Opens the cart in a side panel without leaving the page.Page: Redirects customers to a separate cart page.




Cart note
Allows customers to add special instructions or notes to their order.


Style
​Select the border style.


Thickness
Adjust the border thickness of the cart image.


Opacity
Adjust the opacity range of the border.


Corner radius
Adjust the corner radius of the cart image.


Free shipping bar
​


Enable
Activates the free shipping progress bar.


Minimum amount
Sets the order value required for free shipping. (Default: 500)Customers must reach this amount in their cart to qualify.

theme-settings/offcanvas-drawer.html.title: Offcanvas Drawer
theme-settings/offcanvas-drawer.html.body:
Offcanvas Drawer
The Offcanvas Drawer is a hidden sliding panel used for displaying the menu, cart, or search options in a sleek, unobtrusive way. You can customize the style, color scheme, and separator style for the drawer to match your store's theme and enhance the user experience.

Go to Shopify Admin > Online Store > Themes.
Click Customize on your active theme.
In the Theme Editor, click Theme Settings.
Select Offcanvas Drawer to customize the settings.



This color scheme will be applied to the cart drawer, canvas, and quick view, ensuring visual consistency across these elements.



Color scheme
Select any color scheme defined in the theme settings > Colors > Schemes.




Style
Select the border style.


Thickness
Adjust the border thickness.


Opacity
Adjust the opacity range.


Corner radius
Adjust the corner radius of the cart image.

theme-settings/search-behaviour.html.title: Search Behaviour
theme-settings/search-behaviour.html.body:
Search Behaviour
Shopify’s search functionality helps customers quickly find products, collections, and pages. You can customize search settings to improve results, add filters, enable predictive search, and enhance the search experience.

Go to Shopify Admin > Online Store > Themes.
Click Customize on your active theme.
In the Theme Editor, click Theme Settings > Search behaviour.






Color scheme
Select any color scheme defined in the theme settings > Colors > Schemes.




Search results
​


Pages
Include store pages in search results.


Articles
Display blog articles in search results.


Collections
Include collections in search results.


Products
Include products in search results.


Search card
​


Inherit color
Inherit the color scheme from the global theme settings.


Price
Display product prices in search results.


Style
Changes the style of the solid border.


Thickness
Adjust the thickness of the border.


Opacity
Adjust the opacity of the border.


Corner radius
Adjust the corner radius width for the border.

theme-settings/swatches.html.title: Swatches
theme-settings/swatches.html.body:
Swatches
The Color Swatches settings allow you to customize the appearance of color-based filters in collections and search. These settings help customers easily identify and select products based on color options.

Go to Shopify Admin > Online Store > Themes.
Click Customize on your active theme.
In the Theme Editor, click Theme Settings > Color Swatches.



Option Name to Show as Swatch: Defines which variant options are displayed as color swatches. (eg., color,couleur,farbe)

If your store supports multiple languages, enter translations separated by commas (e.g., color, couleur,farbe).
The variant option named "Color" is automatically converted into swatches.




Width
Adjust the width range of the swatch color.




Height
Adjust the height range of the swatch color.


Corner radius
Adjust the corner radius of the swatch color.


Thickness
Adjust the thickness of the border in the swatch color.


Opacity
Adjust the opacity range of the border in the swatch color.

theme-settings/custom-css.html.title: Custom CSS
theme-settings/custom-css.html.body:
Custom CSS
The Custom CSS option in Shopify's Theme Settings allows you to modify the default styles of your theme, providing greater flexibility in personalizing your store’s appearance.

Go to Shopify Admin > Online Store > Themes.
Click Customize on your active theme.
In the Theme Editor, click Theme Settings > Custom CSS.
Add your CSS code in the provided entry form.
Click Save to apply your changes.

By adding valid CSS entries, you can customize layouts, typography, colors, spacing, and other design elements.

template-creation/product-creation.html.title: Product Creation
template-creation/product-creation.html.body:
Product Creation
Title — Enter the product name (clear and searchable).Description — Write the full product description (features, benefits, materials, sizing, usage). Use short paragraphs and bullet lists for readability.Media — Upload images and/or videos. Recommended: high resolution, consistent aspect ratio, and include multiple angles. You can drag to reorder.Step 3: Set pricingPrice — Enter the selling price.Compare at price (optional) — Use if showing a discount.Cost per item (optional) — Add your cost to track profit (not shown to customers).Charge tax on this product — Toggle on if the product is taxable.Step 4: Inventory

SKU — Stock Keeping Unit (unique identifier you manage).
Barcode (ISBN, UPC, GTIN) — If available.
Inventory policy — Choose Shopify to track this product’s inventory if you want automatic stock decrement.
Quantity — Enter available stock.
Continue selling when out of stock — Toggle if you allow backorders.


Step 5: Shipping 

This is a physical product — Toggle on if it requires shipping.
Weight — Enter weight for shipping calculations.
Country/Region of origin and HS (Tariff) code — Fill if selling internationally.
Fulfilment service — Select if using a third-party fulfilment provider.


Step 6: Variants (if product has sizes/colors) 

Click Add variants.
Add option names (e.g., Size, Color) and values (e.g., S, M, L / Red, Blue).
Shopify will generate variant combinations automatically.
For each variant, you can set an individual price, SKU, barcode, inventory, and weight.

Tip: If you need swatches or custom UI, use theme settings or metafields to render them visually.

Step 7: Organization & visibility 

Product type — Broad category, e.g., “T-shirt.”
Vendor — Brand or supplier name.
Collections — Add the product to manual or automated collections (e.g., “Summer 2025”).
Tags — Add searchable tags (comma separated) for filters and admin organisation.
Sales channels and apps — Choose which channels this product is available on.
Product status — Set to Active to publish, Draft to save for later, or Archived.


Step 8: Search engine listing (SEO) 

Click Edit website SEO.
Page title — Keep it concise and include main keywords.
Meta description — 150–160 characters describing the product.
URL and handle — Customise if needed (avoid spaces/special characters).


Step 9: Advanced: Metafields & Custom content 

Metafields — Use for extra data (e.g., ingredient lists, size charts, downloadable files). Configure them from Settings → Custom data, then fill them on the product page.
Custom templates — Assign a specific product template from your theme if needed.


Step 10: Save & Preview 

Click Save (top right).
Click Preview or use the product URL to view the live storefront version and verify images, description, variants, and SEO.

How to create a product? 
Your browser does not support video.

template-creation/collection-creation.ht.title: Collection Creation
template-creation/collection-creation.ht.body:
Collection Creation
Kindly follow the instructions to create and manage collections for your store. You can organize products into groups based on categories, tags, or conditions to help customers browse more easily. Setting up collections correctly improves navigation, enhances the shopping experience, and ensures your catalogue is structured clearly for better sales performance.

Step 1: Go to the Collections Page

Log in to your Shopify admin.
From the left sidebar, click Products.
Select Collections.
Click Create collection (top right).


Step 2: Add Basic Collection Details

Collection title — Enter the name of your collection (e.g., “Summer Collection”).
Description — Add optional details or promotional text (appears at the top of the collection page, depending on your theme).
Collection image (optional) — Upload an image that represents the collection.


Step 3: Choose Collection Type
Shopify offers two types of collections:
A. Manual Collection
You manually add products one by one.\
Use this when you want full control (e.g., curated picks, featured items).

Select Manual.
After saving, scroll down and click Browse to add products.

B. Automated Collection
Products are added automatically based on conditions you set.\
Helpful for categories like “Red Dresses,” “Under $50,” or “Kids Toys.”

Select Automated.
Choose one or more conditions (e.g., Product tag contains “Summer”).
Set rules like All conditions or Any condition.
Products matching those rules will auto-populate.


Step 4: Set Visibility
Choose when the collection should appear in your store:

Active — Visible immediately
Draft — Hidden
Schedule — Set a date and time to publish


Step 5: Search Engine Listing (SEO)

Click Edit website SEO.
Update the page title, meta description, and URL handle if needed.\
This helps search engines better understand the collection.


Step 6: Save Your Collection
Click Save at the top right.

Step 7: Add the Collection to Your Navigation (Optional)
If you want customers to access it from your menu:

Go to Online Store → Navigation.
Choose the menu (e.g., Main menu).
Click Add menu item.
Enter a name and select Collections → [Your Collection].
Save the menu.

How to create collections?
Your browser does not support video.

template-creation/page-creation.html.title: Page Creation
template-creation/page-creation.html.body:
Page Creation
Use this section to create and manage pages for your store. Pages are used for static content such as About Us, Contact, FAQs, Policies, and custom informational sections. Creating pages helps you provide important details to customers and improves the overall browsing experience.

Step 1: Go to the Pages section

Log in to your Shopify admin.
In the left sidebar, click Online Store.
Select Pages.
Click Add page (top right).


Step 2: Add basic page details

Title — Enter the name of the page (e.g., “About Us,” “Contact,” “Returns Policy”).
Content editor — Add the content you want to display on the page.
You can use text, images, tables, links, or embedded videos.
Formatting tools help structure the page clearly.




Step 3: Choose visibility

Visible — Page is published immediately.
Hidden — Page is saved but not viewable in the store.


Step 4: Assign a page template (optional)

Scroll to the Template section.
Choose a template from your theme (e.g., page, page.contact, page.faq). This changes the layout and structure of the page.


Step 5: Search Engine Listing (SEO)

Click Edit website SEO.
Update:
Page title
Meta description
URL handle This helps search engines understand the content of your page.




Step 6: Save your page
Click Save in the upper-right corner.

Step 7: Add the page to your store navigation (optional)
If you want customers to access the page from your menu:

Go to Online Store → Navigation.
Choose the menu (e.g., Main menu or Footer menu).
Click Add menu item.
Enter a name and select Pages → [Your Page Name].
Click Add, then Save menu.

How to create pages? 
Your browser does not support video.

template-creation/menu-creation.html.title: Menu Creation
template-creation/menu-creation.html.body:
Menu Creation
Use this section to create and manage your store’s navigation menus. Menus help customers quickly find products, collections, pages, and important links. Setting up your menus correctly improves the overall shopping experience and ensures smooth browsing across your store.
Step 1: Go to the Navigation settings

Log in to your Shopify admin.
In the left sidebar, click Content.
Select Menus.


Step 2: Choose which menu to modify
You will see two main menus:

Main menu — Appears at the top of your store.
Footer menu — Appears at the bottom of your store.

Click the menu you want to edit or click Add menu to create a new one.

Step 3: Add a new menu item

Click Add menu item.
Enter the name (the text customers will see — e.g., “Shop,” “About Us”).
Click the Link field and choose the type of link:
Collection
Product
Page
Blog or Blog post
Search
Web address (custom URL)


After selecting the link, click Add.


Step 4: Create dropdown sub-menus (optional)
To make a dropdown:

Add all the menu items first.
Drag any item slightly to the right under a parent item.
It will automatically become a nested sub-menu.

You can repeat this to create multiple levels if needed.

Step 5: Rearrange menu items

Drag and drop items to reorder them.
Move items left/right to adjust hierarchy.


Step 6: Save your menu
Click Save in the upper-right corner.
How to create menus?

template-creation/blog-creation.html.title: Blog Creation
template-creation/blog-creation.html.body:
Blog Creation
Blogs are a great way to share updates, stories, announcements, and helpful content with your customers. Creating blog posts in Shopify helps improve SEO, engage your audience, and add valuable information to your store. Each blog post can include text, images, videos, tags, and featured images. You can also organize posts under different blog categories and choose whether they should be visible to customers immediately or published later.
Step 1: Open the Blog Section

Log in to your Shopify admin.
From the left menu, go to Online Store.
Click Blog posts.


Step 2: Create a New Blog Post

Click Create blog post.
Enter your Title for the blog.
Add your Content (text, images, videos, etc.) in the editor.


Step 3: Add Blog Details

Featured image – Upload an image that represents the blog.
Excerpt (optional) – Add a summary to display on blog listing pages.
Author – Choose the blog post author.
Blog category – Select an existing blog or create a new one (e.g., News, Updates, Tips).


Step 4: Add Tags (Optional)

Tags help organize blogs and make them easier to search.


Step 5: Set Visibility

Choose Visible to publish immediately.
Choose Hidden to draft or schedule for later.


Step 6: Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
Click Edit website SEO to update:

Page title
Meta description
URL handle


Step 7: Save the Blog Post

Click Save to publish or store as a draft.


Step 8: Display Blogs on Your Storefront (If Not Already Added)

Go to Online Store → Themes.
Click Customize.
Add a Blog section or Blog posts block to your homepage or create a dedicated blog page.
Select the blog category you want to display.

How to create blogs?
Your browser does not support video.

template-creation/metafield-creation.htm.title: Metafield Creation
template-creation/metafield-creation.htm.body:
Metafield Creation
Metafields allow you to store additional information that isn’t included in Shopify by default. They help you add custom details to products, collections, customers, orders, and other areas of your store. These fields can be used to display extra information on the storefront, power dynamic theme sections, or support specific app features.

How to Create a Metafield Definition
Follow the steps below to create new metafields for your store:

Go to Shopify Admin\
Open your Shopify dashboard and click Settings at the bottom-left.
Open Custom Data\
Select Custom data from the left-hand menu.
Choose an Object Type\
Click the object where you want to add a metafield, such as:
Products
Collections
Customers
Orders
Variants, etc.


Add a New Definition\
Click Add definition.
Set Up the Metafield Properties
Name: Give a clear label (e.g., Material, Ingredients, Care Guide).
Namespace and Key: Create a unique identifier (e.g., custom.material).
Content Type: Select the appropriate data type:
Text
Number
URL
File
Date
Color
Rating
Boolean
And more.


Example: For a “Material” field, choose Single line text.


Save the Definition\
Click Save to finish adding the metafield.


How to Add Metafield Values
Once a metafield definition is created, you can start entering values:

Open the product, collection, customer, or other object where you want to add data.
Scroll down to the Metafields section.
Enter the value in the provided field.
Example for a product: Material → Cotton
Example for a customer: Size Preference → Large


Click Save.


Examples of Common Metafields

Product Metafields
Material → Cotton
Stone Shape → Round
Care Instruction → Hand wash only
Additional Image → File upload
Video URL → Link to video


Collection Metafields
Banner Image
Short Description
Tagline




Where Metafields Are Used
Metafields help you:

Display custom data on product pages (e.g., materials, delivery info, ingredient lists).
Manage additional content for collections and pages.
Store customer preferences and personalize the shopping experience.
Power dynamic content in custom Shopify themes.

Featured Product
The Featured Products section allows you to highlight selected products on your homepage or any other page. It’s perfect for showcasing best-sellers, new arrivals, or promotional items, making it easier for customers to discover key products at a glance.
To add this section:

In your Shopify admin, go to Online Store > Themes.
Click Customize on your active theme.
In the theme editor, click Add section and select Featured Products.

You can then configure the section settings to choose which products to display and customize the layout to match your store’s design.











Full width
Enable for full-width view. (Controls the container width)


Color scheme
Select any color scheme defined in the theme settings > Colors > Schemes.


Product
Choose a specific product to be featured in this section.


Enable sticky on desktop
Enable to see the sticky on the product image.


Layout



Desktop media width
Adjust the width of the product image for the desktop layout. (Small, Medium, Large)


Desktop media placement
Select the position of the product. (Left, Right)


Borders
Select the style of the border.


Thumbnail options
Choose the thumbnail layout. (Stacked, Horizontal, Vertical)


Zoom options
Enable to view the product with zoom option.


Mobile thumb
Select to show the thumb image on mobile.


Navigation



Style
Choose pagination style. (Dots, Arrow, None )


Padding
Adjust the vertical padding of the section to control spacing. (Top, Bottom)

sections/image-banner/.title: Image Banner
sections/image-banner/.body:
Image Banner
The Image with Text section lets you place an image next to supporting content to create a clean, eye-catching layout. It’s ideal for highlighting promotions, sharing brand stories, or drawing attention to key messages with strong visual impact—similar to an image banner but with added text flexibility.
How to add it:

Go to Shopify Admin → Online Store → Themes
Click Customize on your active theme
In the Theme Editor, select Add section → Image with Text












Full width
Enable for full width view. (Controls the container width)


Color scheme
Select any color scheme defined in the theme settings > Colors > Schemes.


Layout



Position
Set where the content appears within the container.LeftCenterRightTop leftTop centerTop rightMiddle leftMiddle centerMiddle rightBottom leftBottom centerBottom right


Height
Select the height for the section. (Small, Medium, Large)


Appearance



Background media
Select the background type for the section.


Image
Add the image.


Background overlay
Enable to apply overlay on the image.


Overlay color
Pick the overlay color.


Overlay color
Select the overlay style. (Solid, gradient)


Padding
Adjust the vertical padding of the section to control spacing. (Top, Bottom)

sections/slideshow/.title: Slideshow
sections/slideshow/.body:
Slideshow
The Slideshow, sometimes referred to as a banner or carousel, is a well-liked area that lets you display one or more full-page photographs (and/or videos); it is only accessible on our Prestige and Impact themes. To make a lasting impression on your clients, a slideshow is usually the first section on the home page.

Go to Shopify Admin > Online Store > Themes.
Click Customize on your live theme.
In the theme editor, click Templates > Slideshow.
Click Save.












Full width
Enable for full width view. (Controls the container width)


Color scheme
Select any color scheme defined in the theme settings > Colors > Schemes.


Height
Select the height of the slideshow image. (Small, Medium, Large, Adapt).

Select the sliding effect.(Slide, Fade)


Loop

Change slides every
Customize the slide's delay time in seconds.

Choose pagination style. (Dots, Arrow, None)

Show content below images on mobile
Enable the option to show the content below the image on the mobile device.

Select the type of the background media. ( None, Image )


Mobile image
Add the image for mobile view.


Padding
Adjust the vertical padding of the slideshow section to control spacing. (Top, Bottom)

apps/filter.html.title: Filter
apps/filter.html.body:
Filter
Shopify’s product filters help customers refine their search on collection pages or search results pages. Filters are typically displayed as a sidebar, dropdown menu, or drawer to improve navigation and the shopping experience.
Built-in Shopify Filters 

Availability: In stock / Out of stock.
Price: Allows filtering based on price range.
Product Type: Sort products by category.

Step 1: Install the Shopify Search & Discovery App

Log in to your Shopify admin.
Go to the Shopify App Store.
Search for Shopify Search & Discovery.
Click Add app and complete the installation.

Step 2: Configure Filters in the App

In your Shopify admin, go to Apps > Search & Discovery.
In the left menu, click Filters.
Click Add filter.
Choose the Select Source.

How to create a filter?
Your browser does not support video.

apps/complementary.html.title: Complementary
apps/complementary.html.body:
Complementary
The Complementary Products block lets you showcase relevant items directly on the product page, encouraging customers to add them to their order. This can help boost both average order value and conversions. To use this feature, you’ll need to install and set up the Shopify Search & Discovery app.
Step 1: Install the Shopify Search & Discovery App 

Log in to your Shopify admin.
Go to the Shopify App Store.
Search for Shopify Search & Discovery.
Click Add app and complete the installation.

Step 2: Configure Product Recommendations in the App 

In your Shopify admin, go to Apps > Search & Discovery.
In the left menu, click recommendations.
On the recommendations page, click Add recommendations.
Search or select the main product you want to configure.
On the product’s recommendation page, add the complementary products you want to display.

Step 3: Add the Complementary Products Block to the Template 

In your Shopify admin, go to Online Store > Customize.
Select the product template where you want the feature to appear.
In the editor, click Add block.
Choose Complementary products from the list.
Save and publish your changes.

How to create a complementary product? 
Your browser does not support video.

apps/related-products.html.title: Related Products
apps/related-products.html.body:
Related Products
The Related Products section highlights items that complement the product currently being viewed. Displaying these suggestions helps customers discover more of your catalog, increasing engagement, average order value, and overall conversion rates. To enable and manage related product recommendations, ensure the Shopify Search & Discovery app is installed and properly configured.
Step 1: Install the Shopify Search & Discovery App

Log in to your Shopify admin.
Go to the Shopify App Store.
Search for Shopify Search & Discovery.
Click Add app and complete the installation.

Step 2: Configure Product Recommendations in the App

In your Shopify admin, go to Apps > Search & Discovery.
In the left menu, click recommendations.
On the recommendations page, click Add recommendations.
Search or select the main product you want to configure.
On the product’s recommendation page, add the related products you want to display.

Step 3: Add the Related Products Block to the Template

In your Shopify admin, go to Online Store > Customize.
Select the product template where you want the feature to appear.
In the editor, click Add Related product section.
Display the related products from the list.
Save your changes.

How to create a related product?
Your browser does not support video.

apps/language-translation.html.title: Language Translation
apps/language-translation.html.body:
Language Translation
The Translate & Adapt app lets you localise your store by adding translations and market-specific content. It allows you to translate product information, sections, and theme text, helping you deliver a tailored experience to customers in different regions. To use this feature, you’ll need to install and configure the Shopify Translate & Adapt app.
Step 1: Install the Shopify Translate & Adapt App

Log in to your Shopify admin.
Go to the Shopify App Store.
Search for Shopify Translate & Adapt App.
Click Add app and complete the installation.

Step 2: Configure Shopify Translate & Adapt App

In your Shopify admin, go to Settings.
From the left menu, select Languages.
On the Languages page, click Add language.
Choose your desired language from the list and click Next.
Enable the language for the appropriate market using its domain, then click Done.
Click the three dots next to the added language and select Publish.
Click Translate to open the translation dashboard.
Select Auto-translate to automatically translate your store content.
Wait until the automatic translation process is completed.

How to translate language?
Your browser does not support video.

inner-pages/main-product/blocks.html.title: Blocks
inner-pages/main-product/blocks.html.body:
Blocks


For the above-listed blocks, we are not supposed to edit the value or customize it. Just adding the block to the product information section, it will fetch the data from the backend of the product.

inner-pages/main-product/complementary-p.title: Complementary Products
inner-pages/main-product/complementary-p.body:
Complementary Products
The Complementary Products section displays related or add-on items alongside a product. It’s ideal for encouraging upsells and cross-sells by suggesting items that pair well with the main product, helping increase average order value and improve the shopping experience.











Heading
Add the heading text for the complementary block.


Maximum products to show
Adjust the range of the product to show on the block.


Borders
Select the border type.


Carousel settings



Enable carousel
Enable to swipe the products.



How to create a complementary?

inner-pages/main-product/secure-badge.ht.title: Secure Badge
inner-pages/main-product/secure-badge.ht.body:
Secure Badge
The Secure Badge section is used to display trust and security icons, reassuring customers that their payments and personal information are safe. It helps build confidence during browsing and checkout, improving overall trust in your store.











Image
Add image for the secure badge.


Badge title
Add the title text for secure badge.

inner-pages/main-product/fake-sale.html.title: Fake Sale
inner-pages/main-product/fake-sale.html.body:
Fake Sale
The Fake Sale is used to highlight promotional-style offers by displaying original and discounted prices to create a sale-like visual effect. It’s typically used for marketing emphasis, limited-time offers, or to draw attention to specific products or collections.











Min
Minimum products to show on fake sale.


Max
Maximum products to show on fake sale.


Text
Add text to the fake sales block.

inner-pages/main-product/deal-timer.html.title: Deal Timer
inner-pages/main-product/deal-timer.html.body:
Deal Timer
The Deal Timer section displays a countdown timer for limited-time offers or promotions. It creates a sense of urgency, encouraging customers to act quickly and helping boost conversions during sales or special campaigns.


Heading - Add the deal timer heading text here. 
Note: Check the info to create a deal timer block.

inner-pages/main-product/product-rating..title: Product Rating
inner-pages/main-product/product-rating..body:
Product Rating
The Product Rating section displays customer ratings and reviews for a product. It helps build trust and credibility by showcasing social proof, allowing shoppers to make more confident purchasing decisions.


Style: Select the style of the product rating.
Color: Pick the color for the rating.

inner-pages/main-product/inventory-statu.title: Inventory Status
inner-pages/main-product/inventory-statu.body:
Inventory Status
The Inventory Status section shows real-time stock availability for a product. It helps inform customers whether an item is in stock, low in quantity, or sold out, creating transparency and encouraging timely purchases.


Low inventory threshold: Adjust the range of the inventory status. Also, check the info.
Show inventory count: Enable to show the inventory count.

inner-pages/main-product/icon-with-text..title: Icon With Text
inner-pages/main-product/icon-with-text..body:
Icon With Text
The Image with Text section allows you to display an image alongside text, creating a visually appealing layout that enhances storytelling, promotions, or brand messaging.











Icon 1
Choose the icon.


Heading 1
Add the text for the heading.


Alignment
Choose the alignment of the icon. (Left, Center, Right)

inner-pages/main-product/share.html.title: Share
inner-pages/main-product/share.html.body:
Share
The Share section allows customers to share products or pages across social media platforms or via direct links. It helps increase visibility, drive traffic, and encourage organic promotion of your store.


Text - Add the content for the text field.

inner-pages/main-product/custom-liquid.h.title: Custom Liquid
inner-pages/main-product/custom-liquid.h.body:
Custom Liquid
The Custom Liquid section allows you to add your own Liquid code directly within the theme editor. It’s ideal for inserting custom content, third-party scripts, or advanced layouts when built-in sections don’t meet specific requirements.

inner-pages/main-product/description.htm.title: Description
inner-pages/main-product/description.htm.body:
Description
The Description section is used to display detailed product or page content in a clear and readable format. It helps communicate important information, features, and benefits, giving customers a better understanding before making a decision.


Style - Select the style of the block.
Typography - Select the option from the typography. According to the selected option, you will be adjusted to the font family and font size.

inner-pages/main-product/buy-button.html.title: Buy Button
inner-pages/main-product/buy-button.html.body:
Buy Button
The Buy Button section allows customers to purchase a product directly with a single click. It streamlines the buying process by enabling quick add-to-cart or direct checkout, helping improve conversion rates.

inner-pages/main-product/variant-selecto.title: Variant Selector
inner-pages/main-product/variant-selecto.body:
Variant Selector
The Variant Selector section lets customers choose different product options such as size, color, or material. It ensures a smooth selection experience and dynamically updates pricing, availability, and images based on the chosen variant.


Style - Select the type of the variant selector.

inner-pages/main-product/enquiry-form.ht.title: Enquiry Form
inner-pages/main-product/enquiry-form.ht.body:
Enquiry Form
The Enquiry Form section allows customers to submit questions or requests directly from the product or page. It’s ideal for custom orders, bulk enquiries, or pre-purchase questions, helping you capture leads and respond efficiently.


By adding the enquiry form block, the form gets added. Then we can customize the image for the form.
